# MoneyMap-Backend
Backend application for MoneyMap iOS Application. This uses JWT Authentication. It has basic CRUD APIs for User to track all the Money transactions. 

Prefix for APIs - http://localhost:8082

## Description of APIs

1. Create User.
2. Login User ( Receives the JWT token as response).

For Below APIs, pass JWT token as bearer token in the Request header.

3. Get User.
4. Create Transaction.
5. Get All Transactions By User.
6. Update a particular Transaction.
7. Delete a particular Transaction.
8. Update Profile picture(Images are stored in Base-64 String in DB).
9. Signout.


## How to run the project

1. You need to install MYSQL from the official site on your machine and run this command in SQL Shell.
```bash
  CREATE DATABASE moneymap
```

2. Download this repo and open it in IntelliJ IDE(You can download the free community version from the official site). Edit Application.properties to update your MYSQL port no. , username and password for DB User.
<img width="1159" alt="image" src="https://github.com/venugopalreddy701/MoneyMap-Backend/assets/72261416/a7704bcc-9bc6-49ca-815b-21afcf18f229">


3. Hit the build and run buttons on IBE and Your APIs are ready !!! 

<img width="238" alt="image" src="https://github.com/venugopalreddy701/MoneyMap-Backend/assets/72261416/ee7433d6-38c5-4d55-8722-8c8855cebf36">





## Explore REST APIs

### User Creation and Authentication

| Method        |         URL        | Description   | Return          |      
| ------------- | ------------------ | ------------- | --------------- |
| POST          | http://localhost:8082/createUser | Create User   | Success Message  |
| POST          | http://localhost:8082/loginUser   | Login         | JSON Web Token  |

### Get user profile ,update profile picture and Signout

| Method        |         URL        | Description   | Return          |      
| ------------- | ------------------ | ------------- | --------------- |
| GET          | http://localhost:8082/getUser | get User profile | Single JSON object with email and Image as Base-64 String  |
| PUT          | http://localhost:8082/updateProfile   | updates user profile picture         | Success Message  |
| GET          | http://localhost:8082/signout   | Expires the JWT token         | SignOut Message  |

### CRUD Operations on Transaction

| Method        |         URL        | Description   | Return          |      
| ------------- | ------------------ | ------------- | --------------- |
| POST          | http://localhost:8082/createTransaction | Create new transaction | Success Message |
| GET          | http://localhost:8082/getTransactions   | Get all transaction mage by User         | JSON Array of Transactions  |
| PUT          | http://localhost:8082/updateTransaction   | Updates a Transaction with particular ID   | Success Message  |
| DELETE        | http://localhost:8082/deleteTransaction?transaction_id=<id_number>  | Deletes a Transaction with particular ID         | SignOut Message  |

> **_NOTE:_**  
The endpoints of "Get user profile ,update profile picture and Signout" and "CRUD Operations on Transaction" are restricted. To access those endpoints, use the token which is generated after logging-in as the value of the Bearer in the Authorization header as follows:  
**"Authorization: Bearer Token_id"** . Token expires in 150 minutes.

## Sample Request Body

### User - createUser (image is passed as Base-64 String)
```bash
  {
    "email": "venugopalreddy701@gmail.com",
  "password": "venuvenu",
  "profile":""

}

```
### User - loginUser(Request)
```bash
  {
"email": "venugopalreddy701@gmail.com",
  "password": "venuvenu"
  }
```
### User - getUser (Response)
```bash
  {
    "user_name": "venugopalreddy701@gmail.com",
    "profile": ""
}
```
### User - updateProfile(Request)
```bash
  {"profile":""}
```
### User - signout( Based on the Auth. token in header , it expires )
```bash
  [
    "signout"
]
```
### User - createTransaction (Request)
```bash
  {
    "type":"earned",
    "description":"January Salary",
    "amount":89000
}
```
### User - getTransactions (Response)
```bash
  [
    {
        "id": 3,
        "type": "earned",
        "description": "January Opentext Salary",
        "amount": 88430,
        "date": "2024-01-07",
        "userId": 1
    },
    {
        "id": 4,
        "type": "spent",
        "description": "Credit card bill",
        "amount": 2500,
        "date": "2024-01-07",
        "userId": 1
    }
]
```
### User - updateTransaction(Request)
```bash
  {
    "id":"3",
    "type":"spent",
    "description":"January Opentext Salary",
    "amount":89000
}
```
### User - deleteTransaction?transaction_id=2
```bash
  [
    "deleted"
]
```


## Postman Collection
You can import my postman collection file from this repo - [MoneyMap.postman_collection.json](https://github.com/venugopalreddy701/MoneyMap-Backend/blob/main/MoneyMap.postman_collection.json) and see the examples to know how to hit these APIs.

## Swagger Doc

Run the project locally and open url - http://localhost:8082/swagger-ui/index.html#/
